course.title: The Contested Bible: The Sacred-Secular Dance
course.meeting_text: M., W., F., at 10, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: Jay M. Harris (Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations)
course.description: A short history of the Bible. Questions addressed include how the Bible became a book, and how that book became sacred; the advantages and burdens of a sacred text; Jewish-Christian disputations; how interpretive efforts helped create and reinforce powerful elites; how that text became the object of criticism; and how the Bible fared after the rise of criticism.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
